00040 /**
00041  * @file
00042  *
00043  * Interface to the Octeon extended error status.
00044  *
00045  * <hr>$Revision: 44252 $<hr>
00046  */
00047 #ifndef __CVMX_ERROR_H__
00048 #define __CVMX_ERROR_H__
00049 
00050 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00051 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00052 extern "C" {
00053 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00054 #endif
00055 
00056 /**
00057  * There are generally many error status bits associated with a
00058  * single logical group. The enumeration below is used to
00059  * communicate high level groups to the error infastructure so
00060  * error status bits can be enable or disabled in large groups.
00061  */
00062 typedef enum {
00063     CVMX_ERROR_GROUP_INTERNAL,  /* All internal blocks that can always be enabled */
00064     CVMX_ERROR_GROUP_L2C = CVMX_ERROR_GROUP_INTERNAL, /* All errors related to L2C.  Split from INTERNAL, so we map them back to the same group value */
00065     CVMX_ERROR_GROUP_ETHERNET,  /* All errors related to network traffic that should be enabled when a port is up. Indexed by IPD number */
00066     CVMX_ERROR_GROUP_MGMT_PORT, /* All errors related to the management ethernet ports that should be enabled when a port is up. Indexed by port number (0-1) */
00067     CVMX_ERROR_GROUP_PCI,   /* All errors related to PCI/PCIe when the bus is up. Index by port number (0-1) */
00068     CVMX_ERROR_GROUP_SRIO,  /* All errors related to SRIO when the bus is up. Index by port number (0-1) */
00069     CVMX_ERROR_GROUP_USB,   /* All errors related to USB when the port is enabled. Index by port number (0-1) */
00070     CVMX_ERROR_GROUP_LMC,   /* All errors related to LMC when the controller is enabled. Index by controller number (0-1) */
00071     CVMX_ERROR_GROUP_ILK,   /* All errors related to ILK when the controller is enabled. Index by controller number (0-1) */
00072     CVMX_ERROR_GROUP_DFM,   /* All errors related to DFM when the controller is enabled. */
00073     CVMX_ERROR_GROUP_ILA,   /* All errors related to ILA when the controller is enabled. Index by controller number0 */
00074 } cvmx_error_group_t;
00075 
00076 /**
00077  * Category the interrupt belongs to
00078  */
00079 typedef enum {
00080     CVMX_ERROR_TYPE_NONE = 0,   /* Default, no group */
00081     CVMX_ERROR_TYPE_SBE  = 1 << 0,  /* Single bit error for Co-processor blocks */
00082     CVMX_ERROR_TYPE_DBE  = 1 << 1,  /* Double bit error for Co-processor blocks */
00083 } cvmx_error_type_t;
00084 
00085 /**
00086  * When registering for interest in an error status register, the
00087  * type of the register needs to be known by cvmx-error. Most
00088  * registers are either IO64 or IO32, but some blocks contain
00089  * registers that can't be directly accessed. A good example of
00090  * would be PCIe extended error state stored in config space.
00091  */
00092 typedef enum {
00093     __CVMX_ERROR_REGISTER_NONE, /* Used internally */
00094     CVMX_ERROR_REGISTER_IO64,   /* Status and enable registers are Octeon 64bit CSRs */
00095     CVMX_ERROR_REGISTER_IO32,   /* Status and enable registers are Octeon 32bit CSRs */
00096     CVMX_ERROR_REGISTER_PCICONFIG,  /* Status and enable registers are in PCI config space */
00097     CVMX_ERROR_REGISTER_SRIOMAINT,  /* Status and enable registers are in SRIO maintenance space */
00098 } cvmx_error_register_t;
00099 
00100 /**
00101  * Flags representing special handling for some error registers.
00102  * These flags are passed to cvmx_error_initialize() to control
00103  * the handling of bits where the same flags were passed to the
00104  * added cvmx_error_info_t.
00105  */
00106 typedef enum {
00107     CVMX_ERROR_FLAGS_ECC_SINGLE_BIT = 1 << 0,   /* This is a ECC single bit error. Normally these can be ignored */
00108     CVMX_ERROR_FLAGS_CORRECTABLE = 1 << 1,  /* Some blocks have errors that can be silently corrected. This flags reports these */
00109     CVMX_ERROR_FLAGS_DISABLED = 1 << 2, /* Flag used to signal a register should not be enable as part of the groups */
00110 } cvmx_error_flags_t;
00111 
00112 struct cvmx_error_info;
00113 /**
00114  * Error handling functions must have the following prototype.
00115  */
00116 typedef int (*cvmx_error_func_t) (const struct cvmx_error_info * info);
00117 
00118 /**
00119  * This structure is passed to all error handling functions.
00120  */
00121 typedef struct cvmx_error_info {
00122     cvmx_error_register_t reg_type; /* Type of registers used for the error */
00123     uint64_t status_addr;   /* The address of the status register */
00124     uint64_t status_mask;   /* Mask to apply to status register to detect asserted error */
00125     uint64_t enable_addr;   /* The address of the enable register */
00126     uint64_t enable_mask;   /* Mask to apply to enable register to allow error detection */
00127     cvmx_error_flags_t flags;   /* Flags indicating special handling of this error */
00128     cvmx_error_group_t group;   /* Group to associate this error register with */
00129     int group_index;    /* Group index to associate this error register with */
00130     cvmx_error_func_t func; /* Function to call when the error is detected */
00131     uint64_t user_info; /* User supplied information for the error handler */
00132     struct {
00133         cvmx_error_register_t reg_type; /* Type of parent's register */
00134         uint64_t status_addr;   /* The address of the parent's register */
00135         uint64_t status_mask;   /* Mask to apply to parent's register */
00136     } parent;
00137 } cvmx_error_info_t;
00138 
00139 /**
00140  * Initalize the error status system. This should be called once
00141  * before any other functions are called. This function adds default
00142  * handlers for most all error events but does not enable them. Later
00143  * calls to cvmx_error_enable() are needed.
00144  *
00145  * @param flags  Optional flags.
00146  *
00147  * @return Zero on success, negative on failure.
00148  */
00149 int cvmx_error_initialize(cvmx_error_flags_t flags);
00150 
00151 /**
00152  * Poll the error status registers and call the appropriate error
00153  * handlers. This should be called in the RSL interrupt handler
00154  * for your application or operating system.
00155  *
00156  * @return Number of error handlers called. Zero means this call
00157  *         found no errors and was spurious.
00158  */
00159 int cvmx_error_poll(void);
00160 
00161 /**
00162  * Register to be called when an error status bit is set. Most users
00163  * will not need to call this function as cvmx_error_initialize()
00164  * registers default handlers for most error conditions. This function
00165  * is normally used to add more handlers without changing the existing
00166  * handlers.
00167  *
00168  * @param new_info Information about the handler for a error register. The
00169  *                 structure passed is copied and can be destroyed after the
00170  *                 call. All members of the structure must be populated, even the
00171  *                 parent information.
00172  *
00173  * @return Zero on success, negative on failure.
00174  */
00175 int cvmx_error_add(const cvmx_error_info_t * new_info);
00176 
00177 /**
00178  * Remove all handlers for a status register and mask. Normally
00179  * this function should not be called. Instead a new handler should be
00180  * installed to replace the existing handler. In the even that all
00181  * reporting of a error bit should be removed, then use this
00182  * function.
00183  *
00184  * @param reg_type Type of the status register to remove
00185  * @param status_addr
00186  *                 Status register to remove.
00187  * @param status_mask
00188  *                 All handlers for this status register with this mask will be
00189  *                 removed.
00190  * @param old_info If not NULL, this is filled with information about the handler
00191  *                 that was removed.
00192  *
00193  * @return Zero on success, negative on failure (not found).
00194  */
00195 int cvmx_error_remove(cvmx_error_register_t reg_type, uint64_t status_addr, uint64_t status_mask, cvmx_error_info_t * old_info);
00196 
00197 /**
00198  * Change the function and user_info for an existing error status
00199  * register. This function should be used to replace the default
00200  * handler with an application specific version as needed.
00201  *
00202  * @param reg_type Type of the status register to change
00203  * @param status_addr
00204  *                 Status register to change.
00205  * @param status_mask
00206  *                 All handlers for this status register with this mask will be
00207  *                 changed.
00208  * @param new_func New function to use to handle the error status
00209  * @param new_user_info
00210  *                 New user info parameter for the function
00211  * @param old_func If not NULL, the old function is returned. Useful for restoring
00212  *                 the old handler.
00213  * @param old_user_info
00214  *                 If not NULL, the old user info parameter.
00215  *
00216  * @return Zero on success, negative on failure
00217  */
00218 int cvmx_error_change_handler(cvmx_error_register_t reg_type,
00219                   uint64_t status_addr, uint64_t status_mask,
00220                   cvmx_error_func_t new_func, uint64_t new_user_info, cvmx_error_func_t * old_func, uint64_t * old_user_info);
00221 
00222 /**
00223  * Enable all error registers for a logical group. This should be
00224  * called whenever a logical group is brought online.
00225  *
00226  * @param group  Logical group to enable
00227  * @param group_index
00228  *               Index for the group as defined in the cvmx_error_group_t
00229  *               comments.
00230  *
00231  * @return Zero on success, negative on failure.
00232  */
00233 #ifndef CVMX_BUILD_FOR_UBOOT
00234 int cvmx_error_enable_group(cvmx_error_group_t group, int group_index);
00235 #else
00236 /* Rather than conditionalize the calls throughout the executive to not enable
00237     interrupts in Uboot, simply make the enable function do nothing */
00238 static inline int cvmx_error_enable_group(cvmx_error_group_t group, int group_index)
00239 {
00240     return 0;
00241 }
00242 #endif
00243 /**
00244  * Disable all error registers for a logical group. This should be
00245  * called whenever a logical group is brought offline. Many blocks
00246  * will report spurious errors when offline unless this function
00247  * is called.
00248  *
00249  * @param group  Logical group to disable
00250  * @param group_index
00251  *               Index for the group as defined in the cvmx_error_group_t
00252  *               comments.
00253  *
00254  * @return Zero on success, negative on failure.
00255  */
00256 #ifndef CVMX_BUILD_FOR_UBOOT
00257 int cvmx_error_disable_group(cvmx_error_group_t group, int group_index);
00258 #else
00259 /* Rather than conditionalize the calls throughout the executive to not disable
00260     interrupts in Uboot, simply make the enable function do nothing */ static inline int cvmx_error_disable_group(cvmx_error_group_t group, int group_index)
00261 {
00262     return 0;
00263 }
00264 #endif
00265 
00266 /**
00267  * Enable all handlers for a specific status register mask.
00268  *
00269  * @param reg_type Type of the status register
00270  * @param status_addr
00271  *                 Status register address
00272  * @param status_mask
00273  *                 All handlers for this status register with this mask will be
00274  *                 enabled.
00275  *
00276  * @return Zero on success, negative on failure.
00277  */
00278 int cvmx_error_enable(cvmx_error_register_t reg_type, uint64_t status_addr, uint64_t status_mask);
00279 
00280 /**
00281  * Disable all handlers for a specific status register and mask.
00282  *
00283  * @param reg_type Type of the status register
00284  * @param status_addr
00285  *                 Status register address
00286  * @param status_mask
00287  *                 All handlers for this status register with this mask will be
00288  *                 disabled.
00289  *
00290  * @return Zero on success, negative on failure.
00291  */
00292 int cvmx_error_disable(cvmx_error_register_t reg_type, uint64_t status_addr, uint64_t status_mask);
00293 
00294 /**
00295  * @INTERNAL
00296  * Function for processing non leaf error status registers. This function
00297  * calls all handlers for this passed register and all children linked
00298  * to it.
00299  *
00300  * @param info   Error register to check
00301  *
00302  * @return Number of error status bits found or zero if no bits were set.
00303  */
00304 int __cvmx_error_decode(const cvmx_error_info_t * info);
00305 
00306 /**
00307  * @INTERNAL
00308  * This error bit handler simply prints a message and clears the status bit
00309  *
00310  * @param info   Error register to check
00311  *
00312  * @return
00313  */
00314 int __cvmx_error_display(const cvmx_error_info_t * info);
00315 
00316 /**
00317  * Find the handler for a specific status register and mask
00318  *
00319  * @param status_addr
00320  *                Status register address
00321  *
00322  * @return  Return the handler on success or null on failure.
00323  */
00324 cvmx_error_info_t *cvmx_error_get_index(uint64_t status_addr);

00326 void __cvmx_install_gmx_error_handler_for_xaui(void);

00328 /**
00329  * 78xx related
00330  */
00331 /**
00332  * Compare two INTSN values.
00333  *
00334  * @param key INTSN value to search for
00335  * @param data current entry from the searched array
00336  *
00337  * @return Negative, 0 or positive when respectively key is less than,
00338  *      equal or greater than data.
00339  */
00340 int cvmx_error_intsn_cmp(const void *key, const void *data);

00349  * @return Zero on success, -1 on error
00350  */
00351 int cvmx_error_intsn_display_v3(int node, uint32_t intsn);

00355  * before any other functions are called. This function enables the interrupts
00356  * described in the array.

00358  * @param node Node number
00359  *
00360  * @return Zero on success, negative on failure.
00361  */
00362 int cvmx_error_initialize_cn78xx(int node);

00372 int cvmx_error_intsn_enable_v3(int node, uint32_t intsn);

00378  * @param intsn Interrupt source number

00380  * @return Zero on success, negative on failure.

00382 int cvmx_error_intsn_disable_v3(int node, uint32_t intsn);

00384 /**

00386  *
00387  * @param intsn Interrupt source number
00388  *

00390  */
00391 int cvmx_error_intsn_clear_v3(int node, uint32_t intsn);
00392 
00393 /**
00394  * Enable interrupts for a specific CSR(all the bits/intsn in the csr).
00395  *
00396  * @param node Node number
00397  * @param csr_address CSR address
00398  *
00399  * @return Zero on success, negative on failure.
00400  */
00401 int cvmx_error_csr_enable_v3(int node, uint64_t csr_address);
00402 
00403 /**
00404  * Disable interrupts for a specific CSR (all the bits/intsn in the csr).
00405  *
00406  * @param node Node number
00407  * @param csr_address CSR address
00408  *
00409  * @return Zero
00410  */
00411 int cvmx_error_csr_disable_v3(int node, uint64_t csr_address);

00413 /**
00414  * Enable all error registers for a logical group. This should be
00415  * called whenever a logical group is brought online.
00416  *
00417  * @param group  Logical group to enable
00418  * @param xipd_port  The IPD port value
00419  *
00420  * @return Zero.

00422 int cvmx_error_enable_group_v3(cvmx_error_group_t group, int xipd_port);
00423 
00424 /**
00425  * Disable all error registers for a logical group.
00426  *
00427  * @param group  Logical group to enable
00428  * @param xipd_port  The IPD port value
00429  *
00430  * @return Zero.
00431  */
00432 int cvmx_error_disable_group_v3(cvmx_error_group_t group, int xipd_port);
00433 
00434 /**
00435  * Enable all error registers for a specific category in a logical group.
00436  * This should be called whenever a logical group is brought online.
00437  *
00438  * @param group  Logical group to enable
00439  * @param type   Category in a logical group to enable
00440  * @param xipd_port  The IPD port value
00441  *
00442  * @return Zero.
00443  */
00444 int cvmx_error_enable_group_type_v3(cvmx_error_group_t group, cvmx_error_type_t type, int xipd_port);
00445 
00446 /**
00447  * Disable all error registers for a specific category in a logical group.
00448  * This should be called whenever a logical group is brought online.
00449  *
00450  * @param group  Logical group to disable
00451  * @param type   Category in a logical group to disable
00452  * @param xipd_port  The IPD port value
00453  *
00454  * @return Zero.
00455  */
00456 int cvmx_error_disable_group_type_v3(cvmx_error_group_t group, cvmx_error_type_t type, int xipd_port);
00457 
00458 /**

00460  *
00461  * @param group  Logical group to disable
00462  * @param xipd_port  The IPD port value
00463  *
00464  * @return Zero.

00466 int cvmx_error_clear_group_v3(cvmx_error_group_t group, int xipd_port);
